params.name: id
params.description: Must be unique across the domain of your service if `rememberExpanded` is `true` (as the expanded state of individual instances of the component persists across page loads using [session storage](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Window/sessionStorage)). Used as an `id` in the HTML for the accordion as a whole, and also as a prefix for the `id`s of the section contents and the buttons that open them, so that those `id`s can be the target of `aria-control` attributes.

params.name: headingLevel
params.description: Heading level, from `1` to `6`. Default is `2`.

params.name: classes
params.description: Classes to add to the accordion.

params.name: attributes
params.description: HTML attributes (for example data attributes) to add to the accordion.

params.name: rememberExpanded
params.description: Whether the expanded/collapsed state of the accordion should be saved when a user leaves the page and restored when they return. Default is `true`.

params.name: hideAllSectionsText
params.description: The text content of the 'Hide all sections' button at the top of the accordion when all sections are expanded.

params.name: hideSectionText
params.description: The text content of the 'Hide' button within each section of the accordion, which is visible when the section is expanded.

params.name: hideSectionAriaLabelText
params.description: Text made available to assistive technologies, like screen-readers, as the final part of the toggle's accessible name when the section is expanded. Defaults to `"Hide this section"`.

params.name: showAllSectionsText
params.description: The text content of the 'Show all sections' button at the top of the accordion when at least one section is collapsed.

params.name: showSectionText
params.description: The text content of the 'Show' button within each section of the accordion, which is visible when the section is collapsed.

params.name: showSectionAriaLabelText
params.description: Text made available to assistive technologies, like screen-readers, as the final part of the toggle's accessible name when the section is collapsed. Defaults to `"Show this section"`.

params.name: items
params.description: The sections within the accordion.

params.name: heading
params.description: The heading of each accordion section.

params.name: text
params.description: If `html` is set, this is not required. The heading text of each section. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: html
params.description: If `text` is set, this is not required. The heading HTML content of each section. The header is inside the HTML `<button>` element, so you can only add [phrasing content](https://html.spec.whatwg.org/#phrasing-content) to it. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: summary
params.description: The summary line of each accordion section.

params.name: text
params.description: The summary line text content of each section. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: html
params.description: The summary line HTML content of each section. The summary line is inside the HTML `<button>` element, so you can only add [phrasing content](https://html.spec.whatwg.org/#phrasing-content) to it. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: content
params.description: The content of each accordion section.

params.name: text
params.description: If `html` is set, this is not required. The text content of each section, which is hidden when the section is closed. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: html
params.description: If `text` is set, this is not required. The HTML content of each section, which is hidden when the section is closed. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: expanded
params.description: Sets whether the section should be expanded when the page loads for the first time. Defaults to `false`.

params.name: element
params.description: HTML element for the button component – `input`, `button` or `a`. In most cases you will not need to set this as it will be configured automatically if `href` is provided.

params.name: text
params.description: If `html` is set, this is not required. Text for the `input`, `button` or `a` element. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored and `element` will be automatically set to `"button"` unless `href` is also set, or it has already been defined.

params.name: html
params.description: If `text` is set, this is not required. HTML for the `button` or `a` element only. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored and `element` will be automatically set to `"button"` unless `href` is also set, or it has already been defined. This option has no effect if `element` is set to `"input"`.

params.name: name
params.description: Name for the `input` or `button`. This has no effect on `a` elements.

params.name: type
params.description: Type for the `input` or `button` element – `"button"`, `"submit"` or `"reset"`. Defaults to `"submit"`. This has no effect on `a` elements.

params.name: value
params.description: Value for the `button` element only. This has no effect on `a` or `input` elements.

params.name: disabled
params.description: Whether the button component should be disabled. For `input` and `button` elements, `disabled` and `aria-disabled` attributes will be set automatically. This has no effect on `a` elements.

params.name: href
params.description: The URL that the button component should link to. If this is set, `element` will be automatically set to `"a"` if it has not already been defined.

params.name: classes
params.description: Classes to add to the button component.

params.name: attributes
params.description: HTML attributes (for example data attributes) to add to the button component.

params.name: preventDoubleClick
params.description: Prevent accidental double clicks on submit buttons from submitting forms multiple times.

params.name: isStartButton
params.description: Use for the main call to action on your service's start page.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the button.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the textarea. Defaults to the value of `name`.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the textarea, which is submitted with the form data.

params.name: rows
params.description: Optional number of textarea rows (default is 5 rows).

params.name: value
params.description: Optional initial value of the textarea.

params.name: maxlength
params.description: If `maxwords` is set, this is not required. The maximum number of characters. If `maxwords` is provided, the `maxlength` option will be ignored.

params.name: maxwords
params.description: If `maxlength` is set, this is not required. The maximum number of words. If `maxwords` is provided, the `maxlength` option will be ignored.

params.name: threshold
params.description: The percentage value of the limit at which point the count message is displayed. If this attribute is set, the count message will be hidden by default.

params.name: label
params.description: The label used by the character count component.

params.name: hint
params.description: Can be used to add a hint to the character count component.

params.name: errorMessage
params.description: Can be used to add an error message to the character count component. The error message component will not display if you use a falsy value for `errorMessage`, for example `false` or `null`.

params.name: formGroup
params.description: Additional options for the form group containing the character count component.

params.name: classes
params.description: Classes to add to the form group (for example to show error state for the whole group).

params.name: attributes
params.description: HTML attributes (for example data attributes) to add to the form group.

params.name: beforeInput
params.description: Content to add before the textarea used by the character count component.

params.name: text
params.description: Text to add before the textarea. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: html
params.description: HTML to add before the textarea. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: afterInput
params.description: Content to add after the textarea used by the character count component.

params.name: text
params.description: Text to add after the textarea. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: html
params.description: HTML to add after the textarea. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: classes
params.description: Classes to add to the textarea.

params.name: attributes
params.description: HTML attributes (for example data attributes) to add to the textarea.

params.name: spellcheck
params.description: Optional field to enable or disable the `spellcheck` attribute on the character count.

params.name: countMessage
params.description: Additional options for the count message used by the character count component.

params.name: classes
params.description: Classes to add to the count message.

params.name: textareaDescriptionText
params.description: Message made available to assistive technologies to describe that the component accepts only a limited amount of content. It is visible on the page when JavaScript is unavailable. The component will replace the `%{count}` placeholder with the value of the `maxlength` or `maxwords` parameter.

params.name: charactersUnderLimitText
params.description: Message displayed when the number of characters is under the configured maximum, `maxlength`. This message is displayed visually and through assistive technologies. The component will replace the `%{count}` placeholder with the number of remaining characters. [Our pluralisation rules apply to this macro option](https://frontend.design-system.service.gov.uk/localise-govuk-frontend/#understanding-pluralisation-rules).

params.name: charactersAtLimitText
params.description: Message displayed when the number of characters reaches the configured maximum, `maxlength`. This message is displayed visually and through assistive technologies.

params.name: charactersOverLimitText
params.description: Message displayed when the number of characters is over the configured maximum, `maxlength`. This message is displayed visually and through assistive technologies. The component will replace the `%{count}` placeholder with the number of characters above the maximum.[Our pluralisation rules apply to this macro option](https://frontend.design-system.service.gov.uk/localise-govuk-frontend/#understanding-pluralisation-rules).

params.name: wordsUnderLimitText
params.description: Message displayed when the number of words is under the configured maximum, `maxwords`. This message is displayed visually and through assistive technologies. The component will replace the `%{count}` placeholder with the number of remaining words. [Our pluralisation rules apply to this macro option](https://frontend.design-system.service.gov.uk/localise-govuk-frontend/#understanding-pluralisation-rules).

params.name: wordsAtLimitText
params.description: Message displayed when the number of words reaches the configured maximum, `maxwords`. This message is displayed visually and through assistive technologies.

params.name: wordsOverLimitText
params.description: Message displayed when the number of words is over the configured maximum, `maxwords`. This message is displayed visually and through assistive technologies. The component will replace the `%{count}` placeholder with the number of characters above the maximum. [Our pluralisation rules apply to this macro option](https://frontend.design-system.service.gov.uk/localise-govuk-frontend/#understanding-pluralisation-rules).

params.name: describedBy
params.description: One or more element IDs to add to the input `aria-describedby` attribute without a fieldset, used to provide additional descriptive information for screenreader users.

params.name: fieldset
params.description: Can be used to add a fieldset to the checkboxes component.

params.name: hint
params.description: Can be used to add a hint to the checkboxes component.

params.name: errorMessage
params.description: Can be used to add an error message to the checkboxes component. The error message component will not display if you use a falsy value for `errorMessage`, for example `false` or `null`.

params.name: formGroup
params.description: Additional options for the form group containing the checkboxes component.

params.name: classes
params.description: Classes to add to the form group (for example to show error state for the whole group).

params.name: attributes
params.description: HTML attributes (for example data attributes) to add to the form group.

params.name: beforeInputs
params.description: Content to add before all checkbox items within the checkboxes component.

params.name: text
params.description: Text to add before all checkbox items. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: html
params.description: HTML to add before all checkbox items. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: afterInputs
params.description: Content to add after all checkbox items within the checkboxes component.

params.name: text
params.description: Text to add after all checkbox items. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: html
params.description: HTML to add after all checkbox items. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: idPrefix
params.description: Optional prefix. This is used to prefix the `id` attribute for each checkbox item input, hint and error message, separated by `-`. Defaults to the `name` option value.

params.name: name
params.description: Name attribute for all checkbox items.

params.name: items
params.description: The checkbox items within the checkboxes component.

params.name: text
params.description: If `html` is set, this is not required. Text to use within each checkbox item label. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: html
params.description: If `text` is set, this is not required. HTML to use within each checkbox item label. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: id
params.description: Specific ID attribute for the checkbox item. If omitted, then component global `idPrefix` option will be applied.

params.name: name
params.description: Specific name for the checkbox item. If omitted, then component global `name` string will be applied.

params.name: value
params.description: Value for the checkbox input.

params.name: label
params.description: Subset of options for the label used by each checkbox item within the checkboxes component.

params.name: classes
params.description: Classes to add to the label tag.

params.name: attributes
params.description: HTML attributes (for example data attributes) to add to the label tag.

params.name: hint
params.description: Can be used to add a hint to each checkbox item within the checkboxes component.

params.name: divider
params.description: Divider text to separate checkbox items, for example the text `"or"`.

params.name: checked
params.description: Whether the checkbox should be checked when the page loads. Takes precedence over the top-level `values` option.

params.name: conditional
params.description: Provide additional content to reveal when the checkbox is checked.

params.name: html
params.description: The HTML to reveal when the checkbox is checked.

params.name: behaviour
params.description: If set to `"exclusive"`, implements a 'None of these' type behaviour via JavaScript when checkboxes are clicked.

params.name: disabled
params.description: If `true`, checkbox will be disabled.

params.name: attributes
params.description: HTML attributes (for example data attributes) to add to the checkbox input tag.

params.name: values
params.description: Array of values for checkboxes which should be checked when the page loads. Use this as an alternative to setting the `checked` option on each individual item.

params.name: classes
params.description: Classes to add to the checkboxes container.

params.name: attributes
params.description: HTML attributes (for example data attributes) to add to the checkboxes container.

params.name: ariaLabel
params.description: The text for the `aria-label` which labels the cookie banner region. This region applies to all messages that the cookie banner includes. For example, the cookie message and the confirmation message. Defaults to `"Cookie banner"`.

params.name: hidden
params.description: Defaults to `false`. If you set this option to `true`, the whole cookie banner is hidden, including all messages within the banner. You can use `hidden` for client-side implementations where the cookie banner HTML is present, but hidden until the cookie banner is shown using JavaScript.

params.name: classes
params.description: The additional classes that you want to add to the cookie banner.

params.name: attributes
params.description: The additional attributes that you want to add to the cookie banner. For example, data attributes.

params.name: messages
params.description: The different messages you can pass into the cookie banner. For example, the cookie message and the confirmation message.

params.name: headingText
params.description: The heading text that displays in the message. You can use any string with this option. If you set `headingHtml`, `headingText` is ignored.

params.name: headingHtml
params.description: The heading HTML to use within the message. You can use any string with this option. If you set `headingHtml`, `headingText` is ignored. If you are not passing HTML, use `headingText`.

params.name: text
params.description: The text for the main content within the message. You can use any string with this option. If you set `html`, `text` is not required and is ignored.

params.name: html
params.description: The HTML for the main content within the message. You can use any string with this option. If you set `html`, `text` is not required and is ignored. If you are not passing HTML, use `text`.

params.name: actions
params.description: The buttons and links that you want to display in the message. `actions` defaults to `"button"` unless you set `href`, which renders the action as a link.

params.name: text
params.description: The button or link text.

params.name: type
params.description: The type of button – `"button"` or `"submit"`. If `href` is provided, set `type` to `"button"` render a link styled as a button.

params.name: href
params.description: The `href` for a link. Set `type` to `"button"` and set `href` to render a link styled as a button.

params.name: name
params.description: The name attribute for the button. Does not apply if you set `href`, which makes a link.

params.name: value
params.description: The value attribute for the button. Does not apply if you set `href`, which makes a link.

params.name: classes
params.description: The additional classes that you want to add to the button or link.

params.name: attributes
params.description: The additional attributes that you want to add to the button or link. For example, data attributes.

params.name: hidden
params.description: Defaults to `false`. If you set it to `true`, the message is hidden. You can use `hidden` for client-side implementations where the confirmation message HTML is present, but hidden on the page.

params.name: role
params.description: Set `role` to `"alert"` on confirmation messages to allow assistive tech to automatically read the message. You will also need to move focus to the confirmation message using JavaScript you have written yourself.

params.name: classes
params.description: The additional classes that you want to add to the message.

params.name: attributes
params.description: The additional attributes that you want to add to the message. For example, data attributes.

params.name: id
params.description: This is used for the main component and to compose the ID attribute for each item.

params.name: namePrefix
params.description: Optional prefix. This is used to prefix each item `name`, separated by `-`.

params.name: items
params.description: The inputs within the date input component.

params.name: id
params.description: Item-specific ID. If provided, it will be used instead of the generated ID.

params.name: name
params.description: Item-specific name attribute.

params.name: label
params.description: Item-specific label text. If provided, this will be used instead of `name` for item label text.

params.name: value
params.description: If provided, it will be used as the initial value of the input.

params.name: autocomplete
params.description: Attribute to meet [WCAG success criterion 1.3.5: Identify input purpose](https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG22/Understanding/identify-input-purpose.html), for instance `"bday-day"`. See the [Autofill section in the HTML standard](https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/form-control-infrastructure.html#autofill) section in the HTML standard for full list of attributes that can be used.

params.name: pattern
params.description: Attribute to [provide a regular expression pattern](https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/input.html#the-pattern-attribute), used to match allowed character combinations for the input value.

params.name: classes
params.description: Classes to add to date input item.

params.name: attributes
params.description: HTML attributes (for example data attributes) to add to the date input tag.

params.name: hint
params.description: Can be used to add a hint to a date input component.

params.name: errorMessage
params.description: Can be used to add an error message to the date input component. The error message component will not display if you use a falsy value for `errorMessage`, for example `false` or `null`.

params.name: formGroup
params.description: Additional options for the form group containing the date input component.

params.name: classes
params.description: Classes to add to the form group (for example to show error state for the whole group).

params.name: attributes
params.description: HTML attributes (for example data attributes) to add to the form group.

params.name: beforeInputs
params.description: Content to add before the inputs used by the date input component.

params.name: text
params.description: Text to add before the inputs. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: html
params.description: HTML to add before the inputs. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: afterInputs
params.description: Content to add after the inputs used by the date input component.

params.name: text
params.description: Text to add after the inputs. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: html
params.description: HTML to add after the inputs. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: fieldset
params.description: Can be used to add a fieldset to the date input component.

params.name: classes
params.description: Classes to add to the date-input container.

params.name: attributes
params.description: HTML attributes (for example data attributes) to add to the date-input container.

params.name: caller
params.description: Not strictly a parameter but [Nunjucks code convention](https://mozilla.github.io/nunjucks/templating.html#call). Using a `call` block enables you to call a macro with all the text inside the tag. This is helpful if you want to pass a lot of content into a macro. To use it, you will need to wrap the entire details component in a `call` block.

params.name: id
params.description: ID to add to the details element.

params.name: open
params.description: If `true`, details element will be expanded.

params.name: classes
params.description: Classes to add to the `<details>` element.

params.name: attributes
params.description: HTML attributes (for example data attributes) to add to the `<details>` element.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the input, which is submitted with the form data.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the input. Defaults to the value of `name`.

params.name: value
params.description: Optional initial value of the input.

params.name: disabled
params.description: If `true`, file input will be disabled.

params.name: multiple
params.description: If `true`, a user may select multiple files at the same time. The exact mechanism to do this differs depending on operating system.

params.name: describedBy
params.description: One or more element IDs to add to the `aria-describedby` attribute, used to provide additional descriptive information for screenreader users.

params.name: label
params.description: The label used by the file upload component.

params.name: hint
params.description: Can be used to add a hint to the file upload component.

params.name: errorMessage
params.description: Can be used to add an error message to the file upload component. The error message component will not display if you use a falsy value for `errorMessage`, for example `false` or `null`.

params.name: formGroup
params.description: Additional options for the form group containing the file upload component.

params.name: classes
params.description: Classes to add to the form group (for example to show error state for the whole group).

params.name: attributes
params.description: HTML attributes (for example data attributes) to add to the form group.

params.name: beforeInput
params.description: Content to add before the input used by the file upload component.

params.name: text
params.description: Text to add before the input. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: html
params.description: HTML to add before the input. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: afterInput
params.description: Content to add after the input used by the file upload component.

params.name: text
params.description: Text to add after the input. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: html
params.description: HTML to add after the input. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: javascript
params.description: Can be used to enable JavaScript enhancements for the component.

params.name: chooseFilesButtonText
params.description: The text of the button that opens the file picker. Default is `"Choose file"`. If `javascript` is not provided, this option will be ignored.

params.name: dropInstructionText
params.description: The text informing users they can drop files. Default is `"or drop file"`. If `javascript` is not provided, this option will be ignored.

params.name: multipleFilesChosenText
params.description: The text displayed when multiple files have been chosen by the user. The component will replace the `%{count}` placeholder with the number of files selected. [Our pluralisation rules apply to this macro option](https://frontend.design-system.service.gov.uk/localise-govuk-frontend/#understanding-pluralisation-rules). If `javascript` is not provided, this option will be ignored.

params.name: noFileChosenText
params.description: The text displayed when no file has been chosen by the user. Default is `"No file chosen"`. If `javascript` is not provided, this option will be ignored.

params.name: enteredDropZoneText
params.description: The text announced by assistive technology when user drags files and enters the drop zone. Default is `"Entered drop zone"`. If `javascript` is not provided, this option will be ignored.

params.name: leftDropZoneText
params.description: The text announced by assistive technology when user drags files and leaves the drop zone without dropping. Default is `"Left drop zone"`. If `javascript` is not provided, this option will be ignored.

params.name: classes
params.description: Classes to add to the file upload component.

params.name: attributes
params.description: HTML attributes (for example data attributes) to add to the file upload component.

params.name: meta
params.description: The meta section of the footer after any navigation, before the copyright and license information.

params.name: visuallyHiddenTitle
params.description: Title for a meta item section. Defaults to `"Support links"`.

params.name: html
params.description: HTML to add to the meta section of the footer, which will appear below any links specified using meta `items`.

params.name: text
params.description: Text to add to the meta section of the footer, which will appear below any links specified using meta `items`. If meta `html` is specified, this option is ignored.

params.name: items
params.description: The meta `items` add content within a unordered list to the meta section of the footer component. These appear above any text or custom html in the meta section.

params.name: text
params.description: List item text in the meta section of the footer.

params.name: href
params.description: List item link `href` attribute in the meta section of the footer.

params.name: attributes
params.description: HTML attributes (for example data attributes) to add to the anchor in the footer meta section.

params.name: navigation
params.description: The navigation section of the footer before a section break and the copyright and license information.

params.name: title
params.description: Title for a section.

params.name: columns
params.description: Amount of columns to display items in navigation section of the footer.

params.name: width
params.description: Width of each navigation section in the footer. You can pass any Design System grid width here – for example, `"one-third"`, `"two-thirds"` or `"one-half"`. Defaults to `"full"`.

params.name: items
params.description: The items within the navigation section of the footer component.

params.name: text
params.description: List item text in the navigation section of the footer.

params.name: href
params.description: List item link `href` attribute in the navigation section of the footer. Both `text` and `href` attributes need to be present to create a link.

params.name: attributes
params.description: HTML attributes (for example data attributes) to add to the anchor in the footer navigation section.

params.name: contentLicence
params.description: The content licence information within the footer component. Defaults to Open Government Licence (OGL) v3 licence.

params.name: text
params.description: If `html` is set, this is not required. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored. If neither are provided, the text for the Open Government Licence is used.

params.name: html
params.description: If `text` is set, this is not required. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored. If neither are provided, the text for the Open Government Licence is used. The content licence is inside a `<span>` element, so you can only add [phrasing content](https://html.spec.whatwg.org/#phrasing-content) to it.

params.name: copyright
params.description: The copyright information in the footer component, this defaults to `"© Crown copyright"`.

params.name: text
params.description: If `html` is set, this is not required. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored. If neither are provided, `"© Crown copyright"` is used.

params.name: html
params.description: If `text` is set, this is not required. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored. If neither are provided, `"© Crown copyright"` is used. The copyright notice is inside an `<a>` element, so you can only use text formatting elements within it.

params.name: containerClasses
params.description: Classes that can be added to the inner container, useful if you want to make the footer full width.

params.name: classes
params.description: Classes to add to the footer component container.

params.name: attributes
params.description: HTML attributes (for example data attributes) to add to the footer component container.

params.name: rebrand
params.description: If `true`, use the redesigned footer with the GOV.UK crown. Default is `false`.

params.name: homepageUrl

params.name: productName
params.description: Product name, used when the product name follows on directly from ‘GOV.UK’. For example, GOV.UK Pay or GOV.UK Design System. In most circumstances, you should use `serviceName`.

params.name: serviceName
params.description: The name of your service, included in the header.

params.name: serviceUrl
params.description: URL for the service name anchor.

params.name: navigation
params.description: Can be used to add navigation to the header component.

params.name: text
params.description: Text for the navigation item. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: html
params.description: HTML for the navigation item. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: href
params.description: URL of the navigation item anchor.

params.name: active
params.description: Flag to mark the navigation item as active or not.

params.name: attributes
params.description: HTML attributes (for example data attributes) to add to the navigation item anchor.

params.name: navigationClasses
params.description: Classes for the navigation section of the header.

params.name: navigationLabel
params.description: Text for the `aria-label` attribute of the navigation. Defaults to the same value as `menuButtonText`.

params.name: menuButtonLabel
params.description: Text for the `aria-label` attribute of the button that opens the mobile navigation, if there is a mobile navigation menu.

params.name: menuButtonText
params.description: Text of the button that opens the mobile navigation menu, if there is a mobile navigation menu. There is no enforced character limit, but there is a limited display space so keep text as short as possible. By default, this is set to 'Menu'.

params.name: containerClasses
params.description: Classes for the container, useful if you want to make the header fixed width.

params.name: classes
params.description: Classes to add to the header container.

params.name: attributes
params.description: HTML attributes (for example data attributes) to add to the header container.

params.name: useTudorCrown
params.description: If `true`, uses the Tudor crown from King Charles III's royal cypher. Otherwise, uses the St. Edward's crown. Default is `true`.

params.name: rebrand
params.description: If `true`, use the redesigned header and new GOV.UK logotype. Default is `false`.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the input. Defaults to the value of `name`.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the input, which is submitted with the form data.

params.name: type
params.description: Type of input control to render, for example, a password input control. Defaults to `"text"`.

params.name: inputmode
params.description: Optional value for [the inputmode attribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/inputmode).

params.name: value
params.description: Optional initial value of the input.

params.name: disabled
params.description: If `true`, input will be disabled.

params.name: describedBy
params.description: One or more element IDs to add to the `aria-describedby` attribute, used to provide additional descriptive information for screenreader users.

params.name: label
params.description: The label used by the text input component.

params.name: hint
params.description: Can be used to add a hint to a text input component.

params.name: errorMessage
params.description: Can be used to add an error message to the text input component. The error message component will not display if you use a falsy value for `errorMessage`, for example `false` or `null`.

params.name: prefix
params.description: Can be used to add a prefix to the text input component.

params.name: text
params.description: Required. If `html` is set, this is not required. Text to use within the prefix. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: html
params.description: Required. If `text` is set, this is not required. HTML to use within the prefix. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: classes
params.description: Classes to add to the prefix.

params.name: attributes
params.description: HTML attributes (for example data attributes) to add to the prefix element.

params.name: suffix
params.description: Can be used to add a suffix to the text input component.

params.name: text
params.description: If `html` is set, this is not required. Text to use within the suffix. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: html
params.description: If `text` is set, this is not required. HTML to use within the suffix. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: classes
params.description: Classes to add to the suffix element.

params.name: attributes
params.description: HTML attributes (for example data attributes) to add to the suffix element.

params.name: formGroup
params.description: Additional options for the form group containing the text input component.

params.name: classes
params.description: Classes to add to the form group (for example to show error state for the whole group).

params.name: attributes
params.description: HTML attributes (for example data attributes) to add to the form group.

params.name: beforeInput
params.description: Content to add before the input used by the text input component.

params.name: text
params.description: Text to add before the input. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: html
params.description: HTML to add before the input. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: afterInput
params.description: Content to add after the input used by the text input component.

params.name: text
params.description: Text to add after the input. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: html
params.description: HTML to add after the input. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: classes
params.description: Classes to add to the input.

params.name: autocomplete
params.description: Attribute to meet [WCAG success criterion 1.3.5: Identify input purpose](https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG22/Understanding/identify-input-purpose.html), for instance `"bday-day"`. See the [Autofill section in the HTML standard](https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/form-control-infrastructure.html#autofill) section in the HTML standard for full list of attributes that can be used.

params.name: pattern
params.description: Attribute to [provide a regular expression pattern](https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/input.html#the-pattern-attribute), used to match allowed character combinations for the input value.

params.name: spellcheck
params.description: Optional field to enable or disable the `spellcheck` attribute on the input.

params.name: autocapitalize
params.description: Optional field to enable or disable autocapitalisation of user input. [See the Autocapitalization section in the HTML spec](https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/interaction.html#autocapitalization) for a full list of values that can be used.

params.name: inputWrapper
params.description: If any of `prefix`, `suffix`, `formGroup.beforeInput` or `formGroup.afterInput` have a value, a wrapping element is added around the input and inserted content. This object allows you to customise that wrapping element.

params.name: classes
params.description: Classes to add to the wrapping element.

params.name: attributes
params.description: HTML attributes (for example data attributes) to add to the wrapping element.

params.name: attributes
params.description: HTML attributes (for example data attributes) to add to the input.

params.name: text
params.description: The text that displays in the notification banner. You can use any string with this option. If you set `html`, this option is not required and is ignored.

params.name: html
params.description: The HTML to use within the notification banner. You can use any string with this option. If you set `html`, `text` is not required and is ignored.

params.name: caller
params.description: Not strictly a parameter but [Nunjucks code convention](https://mozilla.github.io/nunjucks/templating.html#call). Using a `call` block enables you to call a macro with all the text inside the tag. This is helpful if you want to pass a lot of content into a macro. To use it, you will need to wrap the entire notification banner component in a `call` block.

params.name: titleText
params.description:
The title text that displays in the notification banner. You can use any string with this option. Use this option to set text that does not contain HTML. The available default values are 'Important', 'Success', and null:
- if you do not set `type`, `titleText` defaults to `"Important"`
- if you set `type` to `success`, `titleText` defaults to `"Success"`
- if you set `titleHtml`, this option is ignored

params.name: titleHtml
params.description: The title HTML to use within the notification banner. You can use any string with this option. Use this option to set text that contains HTML. If you set `titleHtml`, the `titleText` option is ignored.

params.name: titleHeadingLevel
params.description: Sets heading level for the title only. You can only use values between `1` and `6` with this option. The default is `2`.

params.name: type
params.description: The type of notification to render. You can use only `"success"` or `null` values with this option. If you set `type` to `"success"`, the notification banner sets `role` to `"alert"`. JavaScript then moves the keyboard focus to the notification banner when the page loads. If you do not set `type`, the notification banner sets `role` to `"region"`.

params.name: role
params.description: Overrides the value of the `role` attribute for the notification banner. Defaults to `"region"`. If you set `type` to `"success"`, `role` defaults to `"alert"`.

params.name: titleId
params.description: The `id` for the banner title, and the `aria-labelledby` attribute in the banner. Defaults to `"govuk-notification-banner-title"`.

params.name: disableAutoFocus
params.description: If you set `type` to `"success"`, or `role` to `"alert"`, JavaScript moves the keyboard focus to the notification banner when the page loads. To disable this behaviour, set `disableAutoFocus` to `true`.

params.name: classes
params.description: The classes that you want to add to the notification banner.

params.name: attributes
params.description: The HTML attributes that you want to add to the notification banner, for example, data attributes.

params.name: items
params.description: The items within the pagination component.

params.name: number
params.description: The pagination item text – usually a page number.  Required unless the item is an ellipsis.

params.name: visuallyHiddenText
params.description: The visually hidden label for the pagination item, which will be applied to an `aria-label` and announced by screen readers on the pagination item link. Should include page number. Defaults to, for example "Page 1".

params.name: href
params.description: The link's URL. Required unless the item is an ellipsis.

params.name: current
params.description: Set to `true` to indicate the current page the user is on.

params.name: ellipsis
params.description: Use this option if you want to specify an ellipsis at a given point between numbers. If you set this option as `true`, any other options for the item are ignored.

params.name: attributes
params.description: The HTML attributes (for example, data attributes) you want to add to the anchor.

params.name: previous
params.description: A link to the previous page, if there is a previous page.

params.name: text
params.description: The text content of the link to the previous page. Defaults to `"Previous page"`, with 'page' being visually hidden. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: html
params.description: The HTML content of the link to the previous page. Defaults to `"Previous page"`, with 'page' being visually hidden. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: labelText
params.description: The optional label that goes underneath the link to the previous page, providing further context for the user about where the link goes.

params.name: href
params.description: The previous page's URL.

params.name: attributes
params.description: The HTML attributes (for example, data attributes) you want to add to the anchor.

params.name: next
params.description: A link to the next page, if there is a next page.

params.name: text
params.description: The text content of the link to the next page. Defaults to `"Next page"`, with 'page' being visually hidden. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: html
params.description: The HTML content of the link to the next page. Defaults to `"Next page"`, with 'page' being visually hidden. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: labelText
params.description: The optional label that goes underneath the link to the next page, providing further context for the user about where the link goes.

params.name: href
params.description: The next page's URL.

params.name: attributes
params.description: The HTML attributes (for example, data attributes) you want to add to the anchor.

params.name: landmarkLabel
params.description: The label for the navigation landmark that wraps the pagination. Defaults to `"Pagination"`.

params.name: classes
params.description: The classes you want to add to the pagination `nav` parent.

params.name: attributes
params.description: The HTML attributes (for example, data attributes) you want to add to the pagination `nav` parent.

params.name: caller
params.description: Not strictly a parameter but [Nunjucks code convention](https://mozilla.github.io/nunjucks/templating.html#call). Using a `call` block enables you to call a macro with all the text inside the tag. This is helpful if you want to pass a lot of content into a macro. To use it, you will need to wrap the entire panel component in a `call` block.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the input. Defaults to the value of `name`.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the input, which is submitted with the form data.

params.name: value
params.description: Optional initial value of the input.

params.name: disabled
params.description: If `true`, input will be disabled.

params.name: describedBy
params.description: One or more element IDs to add to the `aria-describedby` attribute, used to provide additional descriptive information for screenreader users.

params.name: label
params.description: The label used by the text input component.

params.name: hint
params.description: Can be used to add a hint to a text input component.

params.name: errorMessage
params.description: Can be used to add an error message to the text input component. The error message component will not display if you use a falsy value for `errorMessage`, for example `false` or `null`.

params.name: formGroup
params.description: Additional options for the form group containing the text input component.

params.name: classes
params.description: Classes to add to the form group (for example to show error state for the whole group).

params.name: attributes
params.description: HTML attributes (for example data attributes) to add to the form group.

params.name: beforeInput
params.description: Content to add before the input used by the text input component.

params.name: text
params.description: Text to add before the input. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: html
params.description: HTML to add before the input. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: afterInput
params.description: Content to add after the input used by the text input component.

params.name: text
params.description: Text to add after the input. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: html
params.description: HTML to add after the input. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: classes
params.description: Classes to add to the input.

params.name: autocomplete
params.description: Attribute to meet [WCAG success criterion 1.3.5: Identify input purpose](https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG22/Understanding/identify-input-purpose.html). See the [Autofill section in the HTML standard](https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/form-control-infrastructure.html#autofill) for full list of attributes that can be used. Default is `"current-password"`.

params.name: attributes
params.description: HTML attributes (for example data attributes) to add to the input.

params.name: showPasswordText
params.description: Button text when the password is hidden. Defaults to `"Show"`.

params.name: hidePasswordText
params.description: Button text when the password is visible. Defaults to `"Hide"`.

params.name: showPasswordAriaLabelText
params.description: Button text exposed to assistive technologies, like screen readers, when the password is hidden. Defaults to `"Show password"`.

params.name: hidePasswordAriaLabelText
params.description: Button text exposed to assistive technologies, like screen readers, when the password is visible. Defaults to `"Hide password"`.

params.name: passwordShownAnnouncementText
params.description: Announcement made to screen reader users when their password has become visible in plain text. Defaults to `"Your password is visible"`.

params.name: passwordHiddenAnnouncementText
params.description: Announcement made to screen reader users when their password has been obscured and is not visible. Defaults to `"Your password is hidden"`.

params.name: button
params.description: Optional object allowing customisation of the toggle button.

params.name: classes
params.description: Classes to add to the button.

params.name: fieldset
params.description: The fieldset used by the radios component.

params.name: hint
params.description: Can be used to add a hint to the radios component.

params.name: errorMessage
params.description: Can be used to add an error message to the radios component. The error message component will not display if you use a falsy value for `errorMessage`, for example `false` or `null`.

params.name: formGroup
params.description: Additional options for the form group containing the radios component.

params.name: classes
params.description: Classes to add to the form group (for example to show error state for the whole group).

params.name: attributes
params.description: HTML attributes (for example data attributes) to add to the form group.

params.name: beforeInputs
params.description: Content to add before all radio items within the radios component.

params.name: text
params.description: Text to add before all radio items. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: html
params.description: HTML to add before all radio items. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: afterInputs
params.description: Content to add after all radio items within the radios component.

params.name: text
params.description: Text to add after all radio items. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: html
params.description: HTML to add after all radio items. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: idPrefix
params.description: Optional prefix. This is used to prefix the `id` attribute for each radio input, hint and error message, separated by `-`. Defaults to the `name` option value.

params.name: name
params.description: Name attribute for the radio items.

params.name: items
params.description: The radio items within the radios component.

params.name: text
params.description: If `html` is set, this is not required. Text to use within each radio item label. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: html
params.description: If `text` is set, this is not required. HTML to use within each radio item label. If `html` is provided, the `text` option will be ignored.

params.name: id
params.description: Specific ID attribute for the radio item. If omitted, then `idPrefix` string will be applied.

params.name: value
params.description: Value for the radio input.

params.name: label
params.description: Subset of options for the label used by each radio item within the radios component.

params.name: classes
params.description: Classes to add to the label tag.

params.name: attributes
params.description: HTML attributes (for example data attributes) to add to the label tag.

params.name: hint
params.description: Can be used to add a hint to each radio item within the radios component.

params.name: divider
params.description: Divider text to separate radio items, for example the text `"or"`.

params.name: checked
params.description: Whether the radio should be checked when the page loads. Takes precedence over the top-level `value` option.

params.name: conditional
params.description: Provide additional content to reveal when the radio is checked.

params.name: html
params.description: The HTML to reveal when the radio is checked.

params.name: disabled
params.description: If `true`, radio will be disabled.

params.name: attributes
params.description: HTML attributes (for example data attributes) to add to the radio input tag.

params.name: value
params.description: The value for the radio which should be checked when the page loads. Use this as an alternative to setting the `checked` option on each individual item.

params.name: classes
params.description: Classes to add to the radio container.

params.name: attributes
params.description: HTML attributes (for example data attributes) to add to the radio container.

You’ll have an account if you’ve already proved your identity with either Barclays, CitizenSafe, Digidentity, Experian, Post Office, Royal Mail or SecureIdentity.

params.name: navigationEnd

value.text: Barnaby Marmaduke Aloysius Benjy Cobweb Dartagnan Egbert Felix Gaspar Humbert Ignatius Jayden Kasper Leroy Maximilian Neddy Obiajulu Pepin Quilliam Rosencrantz Sexton Teddy Upwood Vivatma Wayland Xylon Yardley Zachary Usansky

value.html:
Pneumonoultramicroscopicsilicovolcanoconiosis is a word coined by the president of the National Puzzlers’ League as a synonym for the disease known as silicosis. It is the longest word in the English language published in a dictionary, the Oxford English Dictionary, which defines it as "an artificial long word said to mean a lung disease caused by inhaling very fine ash and sand dust."

Silicosis is a form of occupational lung disease caused by inhalation of crystalline silica dust, and is marked by inflammation and scarring in the form of nodular lesions in the upper lobes of the lungs. It is a type of pneumoconiosis.

key.text: Its vanished trees, the trees that had made way for Gatsby’s house, Pneumonoultramicroscopicsilicovolcanoconiosis had once pandered in whispers to the last and greatest of all human dreams; for a transitory enchanted moment man must have held his breath in the presence of this continent, compelled into an aesthetic contemplation he neither understood nor desired, face to face for the last time in history with something commensurate to his capacity for wonder.

Pneumonoultramicroscopicsilicovolcanoconiosis is a word coined by the president of the National Puzzlers’ League as a synonym for the disease known as silicosis. It is the longest word in the English language published in a dictionary, the Oxford English Dictionary, which defines it as "an artificial long word said to mean a lung disease caused by inhaling very fine ash and sand dust."

params.description: Can be used to add an error message to the textarea component. The error message component will not display if you use a falsy value for `errorMessage`, for example `false` or `null`.
